channel.title: Strain replacement on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections
channel.description: Recent content in Strain replacement on SciBook: analysis of published information about vaccinations and infections

item.title: Prevalence of HPV After the Introduction of the Vaccination Program in the United States
item.description: Nature abhors a vacuum. By preventing girls from getting the infection from two or four strains of HPV, the vaccine only causes them to be replaced with other strains. There is a decrease in prevalence of the four strains of HPV in young girls, but there is no change in the prevalence of HPV, taking into account all strains of the virus.

item.title: Shift in the prevalence of HPV types in cervical cytology specimens in the era of HPV vaccination
item.description: Oncogenic strains of HPV, 16 and 18, have been replaced with other oncogenic strains: 31, 51, 53, 56 and 66. Three more studies with the same conclusions in Italy, Netherlands and the USA.
